episodeTitle: Get to Building R! The Pirate Alliance's Great Advance!
description: The Straw Hats, Law, and the G-5 Marines break into the laboratory to escape Caesar's deadly Shinokuni gas, but their entry creates a hole allowing the poison to infiltrate. Law directs everyone to Building R and the R-66 passage as their only escape route while Luffy charges forward to confront Caesar Clown again.

events.title: Straw Hats Break Into Laboratory
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates, along with Brownbeard, successfully breach the laboratory facility's wall to escape the Shinokuni gas. However, this creates a dangerous opening that allows the toxic gas to begin infiltrating the building.
events.significance: This action sets up the urgent race to escape through Building R-66 and creates additional danger for everyone inside the facility.

events.title: G-5 Marines Seal the Breach
events.description: The G-5 Marines desperately work to seal the hole in the laboratory wall to prevent the Shinokuni gas from entering, showing their determination to survive despite the dire circumstances.
events.significance: Demonstrates the loyalty and teamwork of the G-5 Marines, setting up their later sacrifice moments.

events.title: Law Reveals Escape Route
events.description: Trafalgar Law directs everyone toward Building R and the R-66 passage, explaining it as the only safe escape route from the facility. He gives everyone a two-hour window before he takes action that will make the base unsafe.
events.significance: Establishes the critical objective and timeline for the escape, creating urgency for all parties in the laboratory.

quotes.text: Find the door marked 'R Building 66'. That's your escape route to the sea.
quotes.speaker: Law
quotes.context: Law explaining the escape plan to everyone in the laboratory

events.title: Zoro Warns Luffy About New World Dangers
events.description: Before Luffy charges off to confront Caesar Clown, Zoro stops him and reminds him of the New World's dangers, telling him he must stay vigilant. Luffy acknowledges his earlier mistake against Caesar.
events.significance: Shows character growth for Luffy as he accepts criticism and demonstrates the crew's dynamic where Zoro acts as a voice of reason for his captain.

quotes.text: This is just the beginning of the New World! Dropping your guard for even a second will be deadly!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro warning Luffy about taking the New World more seriously

events.title: Gomu Gomu no UFO Debut
events.description: Luffy debuts a new technique called Gomu Gomu no UFO against Caesar's satyr subordinates. He twists his legs midair and spins them horizontally like a discus, hovering above the ground while kicking enemies within reach.
events.significance: First appearance of this unique Luffy technique that allows him to hover and attack multiple enemies simultaneously.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy using his new technique against Caesar's guards

events.title: Groups Split Up for Different Objectives
events.description: The alliance splits into multiple groups: Kin'emon and Zoro go to search for the children, Smoker prepares to confront Vergo alone, Tashigi leads the G-5 Marines to find the R-66 escape route, and Luffy charges forward to face Caesar Clown.
events.significance: Sets up multiple concurrent storylines that will play out in upcoming episodes, dividing the protagonists for different objectives.

events.title: Caesar Discovers Empty Cage
events.description: Caesar Clown celebrates the power of his Shinokuni weapon but discovers that the cage he imprisoned the Straw Hats and G-5 Marines in is empty, with no petrified bodies to show off to his brokers.
events.significance: Caesar realizes the protagonists have escaped and are now inside his facility, threatening his operations.

quotes.text: Fehfehfeh! My Shinokuni is perfect! But wait... where are the petrified bodies?
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar realizing the cage is empty

events.title: Caesar Orders Passage Sealed
events.description: After discovering the group is heading for Building R and Gate 66, Caesar orders the passageway between Buildings A and B to be sealed off, then commands a hole to be blown in the sealed section to let the Shinokuni gas flood in.
events.significance: Escalates the danger and creates the life-threatening situation that will lead to the G-5 Marines' sacrifice in the next episode.

events.title: Pirate-Marine Alliance Cooperation
events.description: The episode showcases the unusual but effective cooperation between the Straw Hat Pirates, Trafalgar Law, and the G-5 Marines under Smoker and Tashigi, all working together toward a common goal of survival and protecting the children.
events.significance: Demonstrates the theme that shared objectives can unite traditional enemies, a recurring concept in One Piece.

quotes.text: This is just the beginning of the New World! Dropping your guard for even a second will be deadly!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Warning Luffy to be more careful

quotes.text: Find the door marked 'R Building 66'. That's your escape route to the sea.
quotes.speaker: Law

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how former enemies (pirates and marines) can work together when they share common goals of survival and protecting innocents.
themes.symbolism: The cooperation between Luffy's crew, Law, and the G-5 Marines symbolizes that justice and morality transcend traditional factional boundaries.

themes.description: Zoro's warning to Luffy about the New World's dangers highlights the crew's need to evolve and stay alert in this more dangerous half of the Grand Line.
themes.symbolism: The New World represents a higher level of challenge that requires not just strength but wisdom and caution.

themes.description: The G-5 Marines' determination to seal the breach and protect their comrades sets up the sacrifice theme that will be explored more deeply in following episodes.
themes.symbolism: The Marines' actions demonstrate that loyalty exists on both sides of the pirate-marine conflict.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows growth by acknowledging Zoro's warning about being more careful, while still maintaining his determination to defeat Caesar.
keyActions: Debuts Gomu Gomu no UFO technique
Accepts Zoro's criticism about being careless
Charges forward to confront Caesar Clown

characterSpotlights.development: Law takes on a leadership role by directing everyone to the escape route and managing the two-hour timeline.
keyActions: Reveals the escape route through Building R-66
Sets a two-hour deadline for his plan
quotes: Find the door marked 'R Building 66'. That's your escape route to the sea.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro acts as Luffy's conscience, reminding him of the New World's dangers and the need for vigilance.
keyActions: Confronts Luffy about being more careful
Partners with Kin'emon to search for the children
quotes: This is just the beginning of the New World! Dropping your guard for even a second will be deadly!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded on Law's explanation of the facility layout compared to the manga, providing more visual detail of the escape route.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of Gomu Gomu no UFO, one of Luffy's most visually distinctive pre-timeskip techniques.
The episode's opening song 'Hands Up!' was unavailable on FUNimation simulcasts due to licensing issues, so 'We Go!' was used instead for international audiences.
Episode 604 has an IMDb rating of 7.5/10 based on 780 ratings.
The episode covers portions of manga chapters 678 and 679.
